Through the Lens of John Bria
Saturday, January 6, 2024
3:00 PM
Saturday, January 27, 2024
7:00 PM
Art Spotlight
67 W Granada Blvd
Ormond Beach
United States
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
John Joseph Bria of Palm Coast, Florida, has spent years honing his photography skills. His early fascination with fashion, modeling, and glamour photography has led to his work gracing the covers of numerous magazines, such as “Teen Model, USA” and “Malvie.”
Then came the pandemic, and life changed for many, including John Joseph Bria. While locked down, Bria, already an avid collector of vintage Hollywood photographs, spent much of his time studying the classic works of silver screen photographers of the early 20th century. Through a friend in Los Angeles who worked in the film industry for decades and had a vast private collection of Hollywood photography, Bria discovered the possibilities of tasteful nudity combined with Hollywood’s historical look and feel.
The way they crafted scenes, working with light and shadows to showcase a model, creating a perfect shot telling an entire story, challenged him to change his own style completely. Bria’s portrait photography transitioned from color to black and white. He studied how they achieved those looks, the props, the lighting, and the moods. He practiced shooting with Styrofoam heads for many months, adjusting photo after photo to get the look he was after.
As the time came to venture back into the world with his camera, Bria felt he had perfected his signature style. His current inspiration for vintage works comes from the Ziegfield photographer Alfred Cheney Johnston, who shot Broadway actresses in the 1920s and 1930s. Unlike the lurid images other photographers of the day produced, Johnston's unique style tastefully glorified the beauty of his models. Bria appreciated this and said, “Johnston’s estate discovering thousands of lost photos and plates is the basis of my current works that I call “Enchanting Jazz Age Beauties of the 1920s, The Lost Photos Series.”
“Through the Lens of John Bria” will showcase the Jazz Age Beauties series and other works of Bria’s at the Art Spotlight gallery at 67 W. Granada Blvd, Ormond Beach, Florida, in conjunction with the Ormond Beach Art Walk on January 6th from 3 to 7 pm. The show will run through January.  Aside from the usual reception festivities, John Bria will have a small photo shoot stage set up for the public to come and take their own photos, complete with a backdrop and props.

Group show by artists:

Robert Shannon Turley

"This is Not Art"
Saturday, October 7, 2023
3:00 PM
Saturday, October 28, 2023
5:00 PM
Art Spotlight
67 W Granada Blvd
Ormond Beach
United States
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
Mark your calendars, art enthusiasts! Local Daytona Beach artist Andrew Balint is set to unveil his captivating collection, "This is Not Art," at the Art Spotlight Gallery in Ormond Beach on Saturday, October 7th, 2023, from 3 to 7 pm. The grand opening ceremony will coincide with the Ormond Beach First Saturday Art Walk, making it a must-attend event for art lovers of all kinds.
About Andrew Balint:
Andrew Balint, an accomplished artist hailing from Daytona Beach, has a unique perspective on the world of art. His work is a fusion of influences, from street art to abstract expressionism, resulting in a style that defies conventional definitions. Balint's art has garnered recognition for its ability to challenge preconceived notions and stimulate thought.
Driven by his passion for creating thought-provoking and visually striking pieces, Andrew Balint has carved a niche for himself in the art world. His works can be described as a blend of bold, vibrant colors and abstract forms that beckon viewers to explore their own interpretations. Each canvas tells a story, often inviting the audience to question their perceptions of reality and art.
"This is Not Art" Show Details:
Date: Saturday, October 7th, 2023
Time: 3:00 pm to 7:00 pm
Location: Art Spotlight Gallery, 67 W. Granada Blvd, Ormond Beach, FL
The opening reception ceremony for "This is Not Art" is free to attend, welcoming art enthusiasts, collectors, and the curious public alike. Guests will have the opportunity to meet the artist, Andrew Balint, and engage in conversations about his creative process and inspirations.
Balint's work resonates with those who appreciate art that challenges conventions and pushes boundaries. "This is Not Art" promises to be an unforgettable experience, offering a fresh perspective on the ever-evolving world of contemporary art.
Join us on October 7th, 2023, at the Art Spotlight Gallery for an evening of creativity, inspiration, and artistic exploration. Be prepared to have your perceptions challenged, your imagination ignited, and your love for art deepened.
For more information about Andrew Balint and his art, please visit his website at artbybalint.com.

His work is a fusion of influences, from street art to abstract expressionism, resulting in a style that defies conventional definitions. Balint's art has garnered recognition for its ability to challenge preconceived notions and stimulate thought.
Driven by his passion for creating thought-provoking and visually striking pieces, Andrew Balint has carved a niche for himself in the art world. His works can be described as a blend of bold, vibrant colors and abstract forms that beckon viewers to explore their own interpretations. Each canvas tells a story, often inviting the audience to question their perceptions of reality and art.
"This is Not Art" Show Details:
Date: Saturday, October 7th, 2023
Time: 3:00 pm to 7:00 pm
Location: Art Spotlight Gallery, 67 W. Granada Blvd, Ormond Beach, FL
The opening reception ceremony for "This is Not Art" is free to attend, welcoming art enthusiasts, collectors, and the curious public alike. Guests will have the opportunity to meet the artist, Andrew Balint, and engage in conversations about his creative process and inspirations.
Balint's work resonates with those who appreciate art that challenges conventions and pushes boundaries. "This is Not Art" promises to be an unforgettable experience, offering a fresh perspective on the ever-evolving world of contemporary art.
Join us on October 7th, 2023, at the Art Spotlight Gallery for an evening of creativity, inspiration, and artistic exploration. Be prepared to have your perceptions challenged, your imagination ignited, and your love for art deepened.
For more information about Andrew Balint and his art, please visit his website at artbybalint.com.

Step into a vibrant celebration of identity, courage, and love, an art exhibit honoring Pride Month. This powerful collection expresses what it means to live authentically and love unapologetically. Through bold color, raw emotion, and diverse mediums, each piece invites you to witness stories of resilience, joy, protest, and pride.
Join us for the opening reception for
“LOVE OUT LOUD”
Saturday, JUNE 7th, from 3pm to 7pm
Our opening receptions are free and open to the public. Join us to celebrate Ormond Beach arts and the community. Enjoy the live music by Rebecca Zuhoski aka Rebski, wines provided by RoseVilla Restaurant and lite bites while meeting local artist and browsing the incredible talents that grace our community!
***Limited parking behind the gallery. The medical building lot next door will tow, but there is ample free parking across the street at the elementary school.

What ignites your creativity? Beaux Arts of Central Florida engages in unique abstract/non-objective art making of exceptional distinction. Creating Evocative or Provocative art, our artists are influenced by nature, music, spirituality, social issues or personal experiences. The viewer is left to interrupt the image based on one’s emotions or visual clues inherent in the individual piece. Compelling art is united by a shared vision that runs like a golden thread throughout the assembled works of art -- uplifting, thought provoking, and inspiring.
Opening reception Saturday, October 5 from 3 to 7 p.m. in conjunction with the Ormond Art Walk.

Ormond Beach

Google Calendar
ICS
Opening Reception: August 2, 2025, 3 pm to 7 pm
Art Spotlight invites photographers to submit work for “Black and White,” a juried exhibition exploring the emotional depth and visual power of monochrome photography. The show will run from August 1–30, 2025, as part of the Ormond Art Walk Theme: “Black and White” celebrates the essence of photography truth revealed through contrast, texture, and light. When color is removed, what remains can be more honest, more powerful, and more profound. We welcome works that embrace this perspective across all photographic styles and subjects. Submission Details: Open to all artists working in photography, up to 2 original black and white artworks may be submitted, work must be suitable for public display and ready to hang, if accepted. All submissions will be juried for quality, originality, and alignment with the theme.

Sat, Aug 30, 2025
5:00 PM
Art Spotlight
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
Opening Reception: August 2, 2025, 3 pm to 7 pm
Art Spotlight invites photographers to submit work for “Black and White,” a juried exhibition exploring the emotional depth and visual power of monochrome photography. The show will run from August 1–30, 2025, as part of the Ormond Art Walk Theme: “Black and White” celebrates the essence of photography truth revealed through contrast, texture, and light. When color is removed, what remains can be more honest, more powerful, and more profound. We welcome works that embrace this perspective across all photographic styles and subjects. Submission Details: Open to all artists working in photography, up to 2 original black and white artworks may be submitted, work must be suitable for public display and ready to hang, if accepted. All submissions will be juried for quality, originality, and alignment with the theme.

Mark your calendars, art enthusiasts! Local Daytona Beach artist Andrew Balint is set to unveil his captivating collection, "This is Not Art," at the Art Spotlight Gallery in Ormond Beach on Saturday, October 7th, 2023, from 3 to 7 pm. The grand opening ceremony will coincide with the Ormond Beach First Saturday Art Walk, making it a must-attend event for art lovers of all kinds.
About Andrew Balint:
Andrew Balint, an accomplished artist hailing from Daytona Beach, has a unique perspective on the world of art. His work is a fusion of influences, from street art to abstract expressionism, resulting in a style that defies conventional definitions. Balint's art has garnered recognition for its ability to challenge preconceived notions and stimulate thought.
Driven by his passion for creating thought-provoking and visually striking pieces, Andrew Balint has carved a niche for himself in the art world. His works can be described as a blend of bold, vibrant colors and abstract forms that beckon viewers to explore their own interpretations. Each canvas tells a story, often inviting the audience to question their perceptions of reality and art.
"This is Not Art" Show Details:
Date: Saturday, October 7th, 2023
Time: 3:00 pm to 7:00 pm
Location: Art Spotlight Gallery, 67 W. Granada Blvd, Ormond Beach, FL
The opening reception ceremony for "This is Not Art" is free to attend, welcoming art enthusiasts, collectors, and the curious public alike. Guests will have the opportunity to meet the artist, Andrew Balint, and engage in conversations about his creative process and inspirations.
Balint's work resonates with those who appreciate art that challenges conventions and pushes boundaries. "This is Not Art" promises to be an unforgettable experience, offering a fresh perspective on the ever-evolving world of contemporary art.
Join us on October 7th, 2023, at the Art Spotlight Gallery for an evening of creativity, inspiration, and artistic exploration. Be prepared to have your perceptions challenged, your imagination ignited, and your love for art deepened.
For more information about Andrew Balint and his art, please visit his website at artbybalint.com.

Compelling art is united by a shared vision that runs like a golden thread throughout the assembled works of art -- uplifting, thought provoking, and inspiring.

Mark your calendars, art enthusiasts! Local Daytona Beach artist Andrew Balint is set to unveil his captivating collection, "This is Not Art," at the Art Spotlight Gallery in Ormond Beach on Saturday, October 7th, 2023, from 3 to 7 pm. The grand opening ceremony will coincide with the Ormond Beach First Saturday Art Walk, making it a must-attend event for art lovers of all kinds.
About Andrew Balint:
Andrew Balint, an accomplished artist hailing from Daytona Beach, has a unique perspective on the world of art. His work is a fusion of influences, from street art to abstract expressionism, resulting in a style that defies conventional definitions. Balint's art has garnered recognition for its ability to challenge preconceived notions and stimulate thought.
Driven by his passion for creating thought-provoking and visually striking pieces, Andrew Balint has carved a niche for himself in the art world. His works can be described as a blend of bold, vibrant colors and abstract forms that beckon viewers to explore their own interpretations. Each canvas tells a story, often inviting the audience to question their perceptions of reality and art.
"This is Not Art" Show Details:
Date: Saturday, October 7th, 2023
Time: 3:00 pm to 7:00 pm
Location: Art Spotlight Gallery, 67 W. Granada Blvd, Ormond Beach, FL
The opening reception ceremony for "This is Not Art" is free to attend, welcoming art enthusiasts, collectors, and the curious public alike. Guests will have the opportunity to meet the artist, Andrew Balint, and engage in conversations about his creative process and inspirations.
Balint's work resonates with those who appreciate art that challenges conventions and pushes boundaries. "This is Not Art" promises to be an unforgettable experience, offering a fresh perspective on the ever-evolving world of contemporary art.
Join us on October 7th, 2023, at the Art Spotlight Gallery for an evening of creativity, inspiration, and artistic exploration. Be prepared to have your perceptions challenged, your imagination ignited, and your love for art deepened.
For more information about Andrew Balint and his art, please visit his website at artbybalint.com.

Opening Reception: August 2, 2025, 3 pm to 7 pm
Art Spotlight invites photographers to submit work for “Black and White,” a juried exhibition exploring the emotional depth and visual power of monochrome photography. The show will run from August 1–30, 2025, as part of the Ormond Art Walk Theme: “Black and White” celebrates the essence of photography truth revealed through contrast, texture, and light. When color is removed, what remains can be more honest, more powerful, and more profound. We welcome works that embrace this perspective across all photographic styles and subjects. Submission Details: Open to all artists working in photography, up to 2 original black and white artworks may be submitted, work must be suitable for public display and ready to hang, if accepted. All submissions will be juried for quality, originality, and alignment with the theme.

Opening Reception: August 2, 2025, 3 pm to 7 pm
Art Spotlight invites photographers to submit work for “Black and White,” a juried exhibition exploring the emotional depth and visual power of monochrome photography. The show will run from August 1–30, 2025, as part of the Ormond Art Walk Theme: “Black and White” celebrates the essence of photography truth revealed through contrast, texture, and light. When color is removed, what remains can be more honest, more powerful, and more profound. We welcome works that embrace this perspective across all photographic styles and subjects. Submission Details: Open to all artists working in photography, up to 2 original black and white artworks may be submitted, work must be suitable for public display and ready to hang, if accepted. All submissions will be juried for quality, originality, and alignment with the theme.

Mark your calendars, art enthusiasts! Local Daytona Beach artist Andrew Balint is set to unveil his captivating collection, "This is Not Art," at the Art Spotlight Gallery in Ormond Beach on Saturday, October 7th, 2023, from 3 to 7 pm. The grand opening ceremony will coincide with the Ormond Beach First Saturday Art Walk, making it a must-attend event for art lovers of all kinds.
About Andrew Balint:
Andrew Balint, an accomplished artist hailing from Daytona Beach, has a unique perspective on the world of art. His work is a fusion of influences, from street art to abstract expressionism, resulting in a style that defies conventional definitions. Balint's art has garnered recognition for its ability to challenge preconceived notions and stimulate thought.
Driven by his passion for creating thought-provoking and visually striking pieces, Andrew Balint has carved a niche for himself in the art world. His works can be described as a blend of bold, vibrant colors and abstract forms that beckon viewers to explore their own interpretations. Each canvas tells a story, often inviting the audience to question their perceptions of reality and art.
"This is Not Art" Show Details:
Date: Saturday, October 7th, 2023
Time: 3:00 pm to 7:00 pm
Location: Art Spotlight Gallery, 67 W. Granada Blvd, Ormond Beach, FL
The opening reception ceremony for "This is Not Art" is free to attend, welcoming art enthusiasts, collectors, and the curious public alike. Guests will have the opportunity to meet the artist, Andrew Balint, and engage in conversations about his creative process and inspirations.
Balint's work resonates with those who appreciate art that challenges conventions and pushes boundaries. "This is Not Art" promises to be an unforgettable experience, offering a fresh perspective on the ever-evolving world of contemporary art.
Join us on October 7th, 2023, at the Art Spotlight Gallery for an evening of creativity, inspiration, and artistic exploration. Be prepared to have your perceptions challenged, your imagination ignited, and your love for art deepened.
For more information about Andrew Balint and his art, please visit his website at artbybalint.com.

Mark your calendars, art enthusiasts! Local Daytona Beach artist Andrew Balint is set to unveil his captivating collection, "This is Not Art," at the Art Spotlight Gallery in Ormond Beach on Saturday, October 7th, 2023, from 3 to 7 pm. The grand opening ceremony will coincide with the Ormond Beach First Saturday Art Walk, making it a must-attend event for art lovers of all kinds.
About Andrew Balint:
Andrew Balint, an accomplished artist hailing from Daytona Beach, has a unique perspective on the world of art. His work is a fusion of influences, from street art to abstract expressionism, resulting in a style that defies conventional definitions. Balint's art has garnered recognition for its ability to challenge preconceived notions and stimulate thought.
Driven by his passion for creating thought-provoking and visually striking pieces, Andrew Balint has carved a niche for himself in the art world. His works can be described as a blend of bold, vibrant colors and abstract forms that beckon viewers to explore their own interpretations. Each canvas tells a story, often inviting the audience to question their perceptions of reality and art.
"This is Not Art" Show Details:
Date: Saturday, October 7th, 2023
Time: 3:00 pm to 7:00 pm
Location: Art Spotlight Gallery, 67 W. Granada Blvd, Ormond Beach, FL
The opening reception ceremony for "This is Not Art" is free to attend, welcoming art enthusiasts, collectors, and the curious public alike. Guests will have the opportunity to meet the artist, Andrew Balint, and engage in conversations about his creative process and inspirations.
Balint's work resonates with those who appreciate art that challenges conventions and pushes boundaries. "This is Not Art" promises to be an unforgettable experience, offering a fresh perspective on the ever-evolving world of contemporary art.
Join us on October 7th, 2023, at the Art Spotlight Gallery for an evening of creativity, inspiration, and artistic exploration. Be prepared to have your perceptions challenged, your imagination ignited, and your love for art deepened.
For more information about Andrew Balint and his art, please visit his website at artbybalint.com.

Each canvas tells a story, often inviting the audience to question their perceptions of reality and art.
"This is Not Art" Show Details:
Date: Saturday, October 7th, 2023
Time: 3:00 pm to 7:00 pm
Location: Art Spotlight Gallery, 67 W. Granada Blvd, Ormond Beach, FL
The opening reception ceremony for "This is Not Art" is free to attend, welcoming art enthusiasts, collectors, and the curious public alike. Guests will have the opportunity to meet the artist, Andrew Balint, and engage in conversations about his creative process and inspirations.
Balint's work resonates with those who appreciate art that challenges conventions and pushes boundaries. "This is Not Art" promises to be an unforgettable experience, offering a fresh perspective on the ever-evolving world of contemporary art.
Join us on October 7th, 2023, at the Art Spotlight Gallery for an evening of creativity, inspiration, and artistic exploration. Be prepared to have your perceptions challenged, your imagination ignited, and your love for art deepened.

Art Spotlight invites photographers to submit work for “Black and White,” a juried exhibition exploring the emotional depth and visual power of monochrome photography. The show will run from August 1–30, 2025, as part of the Ormond Art Walk Theme: “Black and White” celebrates the essence of photography truth revealed through contrast, texture, and light. When color is removed, what remains can be more honest, more powerful, and more profound. We welcome works that embrace this perspective across all photographic styles and subjects. Submission Details: Open to all artists working in photography, up to 2 original black and white artworks may be submitted, work must be suitable for public display and ready to hang, if accepted. All submissions will be juried for quality, originality, and alignment with the theme.

About Andrew Balint:
Andrew Balint, an accomplished artist hailing from Daytona Beach, has a unique perspective on the world of art. His work is a fusion of influences, from street art to abstract expressionism, resulting in a style that defies conventional definitions. Balint's art has garnered recognition for its ability to challenge preconceived notions and stimulate thought.
Driven by his passion for creating thought-provoking and visually striking pieces, Andrew Balint has carved a niche for himself in the art world. His works can be described as a blend of bold, vibrant colors and abstract forms that beckon viewers to explore their own interpretations. Each canvas tells a story, often inviting the audience to question their perceptions of reality and art.
"This is Not Art" Show Details:
Date: Saturday, October 7th, 2023
Time: 3:00 pm to 7:00 pm
Location: Art Spotlight Gallery, 67 W. Granada Blvd, Ormond Beach, FL
The opening reception ceremony for "This is Not Art" is free to attend, welcoming art enthusiasts, collectors, and the curious public alike. Guests will have the opportunity to meet the artist, Andrew Balint, and engage in conversations about his creative process and inspirations.
Balint's work resonates with those who appreciate art that challenges conventions and pushes boundaries. "This is Not Art" promises to be an unforgettable experience, offering a fresh perspective on the ever-evolving world of contemporary art.
Join us on October 7th, 2023, at the Art Spotlight Gallery for an evening of creativity, inspiration, and artistic exploration. Be prepared to have your perceptions challenged, your imagination ignited, and your love for art deepened.

Saturday, Sep 7th, 3-7pm in conjunction with the Ormond Art Walk.
In honor of Banned Book Month, we have partnered with Fern & Fable Books. Local artists, inspired by their favorite books have created amazing art.
We invite you to enjoy the creative visual representations of 40+ different books, by 30 artists from 13 surrounding cities in 11 different mediums.

ICS
A show by the Florida Women's Arts Association at the Art Spotlight Gallery.
The Gift of Art comes from the heart. Our multi talented ladies are bringing out their heartfelt works. They are Sharing their passions with the world in a compact masterpiece that will be treasured for years to come.
In conjunction with the Ormond Art walk, the opening reception for this beautiful show is Saturday December 2nd 3-7pm,
Open to the public at the art Spotlight gallery
